enum.name: AL_NONE
enum.comment: No distance model or no buffer

enum.name: AL_SOURCE_RELATIVE
enum.comment: Specifies if the source uses relative coordinates.

enum.name: AL_CONE_INNER_ANGLE
enum.comment: The angle covered by the inner cone, the area within which the source will not be attenuated by direction.

enum.name: AL_CONE_OUTER_ANGLE
enum.comment: The angle covered by the outer cone, the area outside of which the source will be fully attenuated by direction.

enum.name: AL_PITCH
enum.comment: A multiplier for the sample rate of the source's buffer.

enum.name: AL_POSITION
enum.comment:
The source or listener location in three dimensional space.
OpenAL uses a right handed coordinate system, like OpenGL, where with a default view, X points right (thumb), Y points up (index finger), and Z points towards the viewer/camera (middle finger).
To change from or to a left handed coordinate system, negate the Z component.

enum.name: AL_DIRECTION
enum.comment:
Specifies the current direction in local space. A zero-length vector specifies an omni-directional source (cone is ignored).
To change from or to a left handed coordinate system, negate the Z component.

enum.name: AL_VELOCITY
enum.comment:
Specifies the current velocity, relative to the position.
To change from or to a left handed coordinate system, negate the Z component.

enum.name: AL_BUFFER
enum.comment: Specifies the buffer to provide sound samples for a source.

enum.name: AL_GAIN
enum.comment:
For sources, an initial linear gain value (before attenuation is applied). For the listener, an output linear gain adjustment.
A value of 1.0 means unattenuated. Each division by 2 equals an attenuation of about -6dB. Each multiplication by 2 equals an amplification of about +6dB.

enum.name: AL_MIN_GAIN
enum.comment: The minimum gain allowed for a source, after distance and cone attenuation are applied (if applicable).

enum.name: AL_MAX_GAIN
enum.comment: The maximum gain allowed for a source, after distance and cone attenuation are applied (if applicable).

enum.name: AL_ORIENTATION
enum.comment:
Effectively two three dimensional vectors. The first vector is the front (or "at") and the second is the top (or "up"). Both vectors are relative to the listener position.
To change from or to a left handed coordinate system, negate the Z component of both vectors.

enum.name: AL_BUFFERS_QUEUED
enum.comment: The number of buffers queued using alSourceQueueBuffers, minus the buffers removed with alSourceUnqueueBuffers.

enum.name: AL_BUFFERS_PROCESSED
enum.comment: Source Buffer Queue processed count (query only).

The number of queued buffers that have been fully processed, and can be removed with alSourceUnqueueBuffers.
Looping sources will never fully process buffers because they will be set to play again for when the source loops.

enum.name: AL_REFERENCE_DISTANCE
enum.comment:
The distance in units that no distance attenuation occurs.
At 0.0, no distance attenuation occurs with non-linear attenuation models.

enum.name: AL_ROLLOFF_FACTOR
enum.comment:
Multiplier to exaggerate or diminish distance attenuation.
At 0.0, no distance attenuation ever occurs.

enum.name: AL_CONE_OUTER_GAIN
enum.comment: The gain attenuation applied when the listener is outside of the source's outer cone angle.

enum.name: AL_MAX_DISTANCE
enum.comment: The distance above which the source is not attenuated any further with a clamped distance model, or where attenuation reaches 0.0 gain for linear distance models with a default rolloff factor.

enum.name: AL_SAMPLE_OFFSET
enum.comment: Source buffer offset, in sample frames.

enum.name: AL_SOURCE_TYPE
enum.comment:
A Source is Static if a Buffer has been attached using AL_BUFFER.
A Source is Streaming if one or more Buffers have been attached using alSourceQueueBuffers.
A Source is Undetermined when it has the NULL buffer attached using AL_BUFFER.

enum.name: AL_SIZE
enum.comment: Buffer data size in bytes (query only).

enum.name: AL_INVALID_NAME
enum.comment: Invalid name (ID) passed to an AL call.

enum.name: AL_INVALID_ENUM
enum.comment: Invalid enumeration passed to AL call.

enum.name: AL_INVALID_VALUE
enum.comment: Invalid value passed to AL call.

enum.name: AL_OUT_OF_MEMORY
enum.comment: Not enough memory to execute the AL call.

enum.name: AL_DOPPLER_FACTOR
enum.comment: Scale for source and listener velocities.

enum.name: AL_DOPPLER_VELOCITY
enum.comment: A multiplier applied to the Speed of Sound.

enum.name: AL_SPEED_OF_SOUND
enum.comment: Speed of Sound, in units per second.
The speed at which sound waves are assumed to travel, when calculating the doppler effect from source and listener velocities.

enum.name: AL_DISTANCE_MODEL
enum.comment:
The model by which sources attenuate with distance.
None - No distance attenuation. Inverse - Doubling the distance halves the source gain. Linear - Linear gain scaling between the reference and max distances. Exponent - Exponential gain dropoff.
Clamped variations work like the non-clamped counterparts, except the distance calculated is clamped between the reference and max distances.

enum.name: ALC_SYNC
enum.comment: Context attribute: AL_TRUE or AL_FALSE synchronous context?

enum.name: ALC_INVALID_ENUM
enum.comment: Invalid enumeration passed to an ALC call.

enum.name: ALC_INVALID_VALUE
enum.comment: Invalid value passed to an ALC call.

enum.name: ALC_DEFAULT_DEVICE_SPECIFIER
enum.comment: String for the default device specifier.

enum.name: ALC_DEVICE_SPECIFIER
enum.comment:
Device specifier string.
If device handle is NULL, it is instead a null-character separated list of strings of known device specifiers (list ends with an empty string).

enum.name: ALC_EXTENSIONS
enum.comment: String for space-separated list of ALC extensions.

enum.name: ALC_CAPTURE_DEVICE_SPECIFIER
enum.comment:
Capture specifier string.
If device handle is NULL, it is instead a null-character separated list of strings of known device specifiers (list ends with an empty string).

enum.name: ALC_CAPTURE_DEFAULT_DEVICE_SPECIFIER
enum.comment: String for the default capture device specifier.

enum.name: ALC_CAPTURE_SAMPLES
enum.comment: Number of sample frames available for capture.

enum.name: ALC_DEFAULT_ALL_DEVICES_SPECIFIER
enum.comment: String for the default extended device specifier.

enum.name: ALC_ALL_DEVICES_SPECIFIER
enum.comment:
Device's extended specifier string.
If device handle is NULL, it is instead a null-character separated list of strings of known extended device specifiers (list ends with an empty string).

command.comment: Obtain the first error generated in the AL context since the last call to this function.
Query for the presence of an extension on the AL context.
Retrieve the address of a function. The returned function may be context- specific.
Retrieve the value of an enum. The returned value may be context-specific.
Create source objects.
Delete source objects.

command.command: Verify an ID is for a valid source.

command.comment: Play, restart, or resume a source, setting its state to AL_PLAYING.
Stop a source, setting its state to AL_STOPPED if playing or paused.
Rewind a source, setting its state to AL_INITIAL.
Pause a source, setting its state to AL_PAUSED if playing.
Play, restart, or resume a list of sources atomically.
Stop a list of sources atomically.
Rewind a list of sources atomically.
Pause a list of sources atomically.
Queue buffers onto a source
Unqueue processed buffers from a source
Create buffer objects
Delete buffer objects
Verify an ID is a valid buffer (including the NULL buffer)
Copies data into the buffer, interpreting it using the specified format and samplerate.
Create and attach a context to the given device.
Makes the given context the active process-wide context. Passing NULL clears the active context.
Resumes processing updates for the given context.
Suspends updates for the given context..
Remove a context from its device and destroys it.
Returns the currently active context.
Returns the device that a particular context is attached to.
Opens the named playback device.
Closes the given playback device.
Obtain the most recent Device error.
Query for the presence of an extension on the device. Pass a NULL device to query a device-inspecific extension.
Retrieve the address of a function. Given a non-NULL device, the returned function may be device-specific.
Retrieve the value of an enum. Given a non-NULL device, the returned value may be device-specific.
Returns information about the device, and error strings.
Returns information about the device and the version of OpenAL.
Opens the named capture device with the given frequency, format, and buffer size.
Closes the given capture device.
Starts capturing samples into the device buffer.
Stops capturing samples. Samples in the device buffer remain available.
Reads samples from the device buffer.

require.comment: Buffer state. Not for public use.
